themes: need for alternative or increased funding sources
frustration with frequent changes to grant guidelines
preference for supporting grassroots organizations over large institutions
lack of accountability for major institutions
importance of capacity building and sustainability
key_phrases: HOT taxes will never be enough
significant effort put into increasing the HOT allotment
establishing other ways to fund arts & culture
Re-writing the grant guidelines every 2 years only causes more frustration, distrust and confusion
pay the local organizations, non-profits and individuals already doing the grassroots work
spending large amounts on larger institutions (The Long Center, Miles Partnership) who do not have a strong connection with the community and who are not held accountable
Capacity building and sustainability should always be at the forefront
barriers_identified: frequent changes to grant guidelines causing frustration, distrust and confusion
large institutions lacking community connection and accountability
solutions_proposed: increase the HOT allotment diverted from the Convention Center
establish other ways to fund arts & culture
reduce frequency of rewriting grant guidelines
prioritize funding for local organizations, non-profits, and individuals doing grassroots work
focus on capacity building and sustainability
